Some au- thors (de Melo and Weikum, 2008) propose trans- lating PWN to wordnets in other lan- guages, but if this might be suitable for several ap- plications, a problem arises because different lan- guages represent different socio-cultural realities, do not cover exactly the same part of the lexicon and, even where they seem to be common, several concepts are lexicalised differently (Hirst, 2004).

Knowledge about words and their meanings is typically structured in lex- ical ontologies, such as PWN (Fell- baum, 1998), but this kind of resources is most of the times handcrafted, which implies much time- consuming human effort.
